bug.author: MedKhem
bug.summary: Line status feature: "Line end" not captured for many instances in an OCRized dictionary sample
bug.description: The file "<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kermitt2/grobid/files/557933/LettreP-117082016.pdf>LettreP-117082016.pdf</denchmark-link> " contains a OCRized scan from a dictionary page. The method in captures just 6 "LINEEND" instances out of ~60. Here is the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kermitt2/grobid/files/557963/LettreP_feature_matrix.txt>LettreP_feature_matrix.txt</denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MedKhem>@MedKhem</denchmark-link> ! I found the error. It should be fixed on the master branch thanks to the last commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kermitt2/grobid/commit/2916deeee34525640ddd9fde38afae2be4f7fa27>2916dee</denchmark-link>
And it has a small but positive impact on body processing according to evaluation on PubMedCentral sample. Thanks in advance if you could test again for confirmation.
I have just tested again and the problem is fixed. I think you could close it :)
